definition.name: Deploy to AKS
definition.description: Deploy to an Azure Kubernetes Service cluster
definition.author: azure

inputs.name: method
inputs.description: Acceptable values: kubeconfig or service-account

inputs.name: kubeconfig
inputs.description: Contents of kubeconfig file

inputs.name: context
inputs.description: If your kubeconfig has multiple contexts, use this field to use a specific context, otherwise the default one would be chosen

inputs.name: k8s-url
inputs.description: Cluster Url

inputs.name: k8s-secret
inputs.description: Service account secret. Run kubectl get serviceaccounts <service-account-name> -o yaml and copy the service-account-secret-name. Copy the ouptut of kubectl get secret <service-account-secret-name> -o yaml

inputs.name: container-registry-url
inputs.description: Container registry url

inputs.name: container-registry-username
inputs.description: Container registry username

inputs.name: container-registry-password
inputs.description: Container registry password

inputs.name: container-registry-email
inputs.description: Container registry email

inputs.name: secret-type
inputs.description: Type of Kubernetes secret. For example, docker-registry or generic

inputs.name: secret-name
inputs.description: Name of the secret. You can use this secret name in the Kubernetes YAML configuration file.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.description: Specify keys and literal values to insert in generic type secret. For example, --from-literal=key1=value1 --from-literal=key2="top secret".

inputs.name: manifests
inputs.description: Path to the manifest files which will be used for deployment.

inputs.name: images
inputs.description: Fully qualified resource URL of the image(s) to be used for substitutions on the manifest files Example: contosodemo.azurecr.io/helloworld:test

inputs.name: imagepullsecrets
inputs.description: Name of a docker-registry secret that has already been set up within the cluster. Each of these secret names are added under imagePullSecrets field for the workloads found in the input manifest files

inputs.name: kubectl-version
inputs.description: Version of kubectl. Installs a specific version of kubectl binary

inputs.name: strategy
inputs.description: Deployment strategy to be used. Allowed values are none, canary

inputs.name: traffic-split-method
inputs.description: Traffic split method to be used. Allowed values are pod, smi

inputs.name: baseline-and-canary-replicas
inputs.description: Baseline and canary replicas count; valid value i.e between 0 to 100.

inputs.name: percentage
inputs.description: Percentage of traffic redirect to canary deployment

inputs.name: args
inputs.description: Arguments

inputs.name: action
inputs.description: deploy/promote/reject

inputs.name: namespace
inputs.description: Choose the target Kubernetes namespace. If the namespace is not provided, the commands will run in the default namespace.
